Reviews.Title: Two Thumbs Up - Excellent to record Action Shots!!
Reviews.Author: Elliot Bernstein
Reviews.Content: I primarily shoot with higher end DSLR cameras.  I bought this camera mainly because of its ability to shoot at 40fps and to have a fun, pocket sized snapshot camera.  It certainly does delivery on its promises, and does a great job of doing it!  It is about the same size as common P&S; cameras but is loaded with great features that gives it an edge over other cameras.The button to switch from single shot to high speed and back to single shot is conveniently located at the top of the camera. Push the button and you are in high speed mode.  Push it again and you have a regular camera. If you shoot action shots and are not good at timing your shots to 'capture the moment', you will love this camera.  If you have kids and they do sports, you will LOVE this camera.The camera can be used in a fully automatic mode, fully manual, or anywhere in-between. Access to all the shooting settings is accomplished by pushing one button as well (on the command dial), so you can adjust aperture, shutter speed, ISO, exposure compensation, white balance, frame rate for high speed shootings, buffer settings, etc.  The MENU button allows you to access typical setup features and reformat the memory card.Auto focus is fast and accurate.  The focus tracking feature works, and works great.  Metering is excellent as well giving consistent, correctly exposed images.The lens gives very sharp pictures with nice color and contrast.  The zoom on the long end to too strong to use effectively without a tripod, even with the image stabilizer on.  It is easy to get good 12x shots though.Like just about any P&S; camera, good lighting is the key to success.  Very low light performance is only good at best, but keep in mind it is typical just like any P&S; camera.  If you plan to use your camera in low light often, you may be better off with a P&S; that has a f2.8 (or faster) lens, or a micro 4/3 or DSLR camera where you can put a fast lens on the camera.  The flash works well when needed, providing even, accurate light without hot spots and naturally looking pictures.Video quality appears to be very good although I have not viewed the HD video on my HDTV.  Video can be recorded in slow motion but resolution is quite low and probably only suited to viewing on a computer.  It also requires a lot of light.  Shooting under fluorescent lights in slow motion can produce a flicker effect in the lighting.I have owned several P&S; cameras.  This one is loaded with features that give it an advantage over many other P&S; cameras.  Although it is a little bit more expensive than some typical cameras, because of its high speed image capture features, it is an excellent value (if you need and can use those features, of course).One other drawback is is slow write speed to the memory card.  I did not notice any difference using a high speed memory card to a slower speed card.  This is not an issue for single shots or if you shot in small bursts.  But, if you shoot a burst of 30 shots, you might have to wait 20 seconds for all the images to be written to the memory card, You can of course still continue to shoot (up to the buffer capacity).  You cannot view images while the buffer is clearing.  I don't know if this camera is any faster or slower in write speed to other similar cameras.  But of course, I don't believe there are other cameras that take 30 frames in 3/4 of a second and have to write so many images to a memory card at one time!The panorama mode of this camera is excellent, providing seamless panorama shots with ease - the entire process is automatic.  All you have to do is pan the camera smoothly as you hold the shutter down.I did a side-by-side comparison of this camera Vs a Lumix P&S; that my friend has.  His camera has a Leica lens.  The image quality was basically identical and indistinguishable between the two at both low and high ISO.  I have read a couple of reviews about this camera not giving sharp images.  If you are not getting sharp images, there is something wrong with your technique as the lens on this camera is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Most fun I've had with a camera
Reviews.Author: Lane
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera. I'm not a professional photographer so may not be as picky about all of the smallest details but I know my way around a camera and this one is awesome. I couldn't decide which camera to go with and after reading a few not so hot personal reviews I got a little worried but now I'm definitely glad I went with the Casio.I wanted a camera that shoots 1080HD, this one does it and seems to do it very well. It also has an HDMI output build right in so thats a big plus.I was really interested in the high speed capabilities of this thing as its the only one I could find that has it. Its really revolutionary and is a game changer as far as I'm concerned. I was amazed that the average person could get high speed technology for only $240. Its not perfect as the image quality decreases quite abit the higher frames per second that you go but you can still get very impressive results. The key is to get a lot of light, just the same as what the professionals need for their hundred thousand dollar cameras. I put three or four lights shining on the table and spun a quarter and got really awesome results. It showed up clearly even at 1000fps and looked incredible as it slowly turned. You can watch the unedited footage in amazement so I can't wait to see what I can do after some editing. I'm definitely gonna have a lot of fun with this feature.I read reviews that said the HDart feature is overhyped and useless but I don't agree. Although its nothing too incredible, it does give some really cool results. It instantly turns a regular picture into a work of art of sorts and I think I'll definitely be able to use it to create some cool images.One of the other great features in the panorama shot. I don't have much experience with this so when I first did it I was really impressed. It takes a 360 degree picture and, from what I saw, it stitched them together almost perfectly. Its a pretty amazing feature and you can definitely have fun with it. I can't wait to try it out on some outdoor scenery.Since this little device is also a digital camera I better touch on that, haha. The still pictures were very good in my opinion. The colors were great and really popped. Some people will complain about the sharpness of the images and if you really zoom in, yeah of course its gonna start getting grainy. If you take the picture and are looking at the full picture, however, it looks great. It does a good job of focusing and automatically adjusting depending on the light in the room. Also since one review said it didn't have an autopreview after you take the picture I'll mention that it does, you just have to go to the menu and turn it on.Overall I was very pleased with this camera. If it had cost $900 I may have been a little more picky about image quality but at $240 this thing is incredible. Seriously, if you're gonna complain about image quality, go buy yourself a $2000 canon or nikon. And if you're gonna write poor reviews because you don't take two minutes to learn the menu system and features then ask your grandkids to show you how the thing works first. And if you're just on amazon looking for a great little camera that gives you awesome pictures plus an endless set of fun features then don't hesitate to buy this one.

Reviews.Title: Good video and image quality but image stabilization a problem
Reviews.Author: RIK
Reviews.Content: Pros1. Compact. Packs 12.5x optical zoom in a 1.1" body, competitors are on 1.3" or 1.4" bodies (though Nikon S9100 packs an 18x optical zoom in that slightly larger form factor).2. Fast operations3. Good low light pictures - a definite improvement from previous Exilims4. Good video - again a definite improvement from previous Exilims5. Panorama mode better than the Sony Cybershot DSC HX9V.6. Flash doesn't pop-up and take the space where you'd keep your finger (as in Nikon Coolpix S9100, Canon Powershot SX230 or Sony Cybershot DSC HX9V)Cons1. Poor image stabilization. Low light images with optical zoom extended all the way were mostly blurry. Was a deal breaker for me.2. Battery meter was flaky - I saw it indicate solid (meaning full battery) before starting on a picture, medium when focusing and low immediately after the picture was taken. Obviously no single picture can suddenly drain the battery. Also for some reason the battery life is not as good as previous Exilims (which has again been a Casio differentiator)Check out dcresource.com, pcmag.com and cnet.com for professional reviews of compact superzooms. I still haven't found one from the 2011 crop that I'd recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great All-Around Everyday Camera
Reviews.Author: P. Detrick
Reviews.Content: I am not a highly experienced or professional photographer, just a casual amateur.  I was looking for a camera which could act like a P&S; for my wife, yet offer high-speed and some other sophisticated features for me at sporting events.  This little gem has met all those requirements extremely well.  The continuous shutter and high-speed features are stunning, allowing me to capture the pitch leaving the pitcher's hand or the ball leaving the batter's bat.  For me, this is a thrilling capability.  I also like the panorama capability.  The telephoto with anti-shake works great, giving clear crisp photos even when my hand is having difficulty holding the focus area on a small item.  The large screen, with higher than average pixels, is a pleasure to use - very clear viewing and a fairly intuitive menu system.The small size and light weight let this little wonder fit easily in my pant pocket or my wife's purse.  The only feature I have yet to explore is the HD movie, but I expect it to be as great as the other features - if not, I will update this review in the future.  I highly recommend this camera and am totally baffled by negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: Camera Review
Reviews.Author: m2man
Reviews.Content: This item has to be the best pocket camera ever.  I have had this camera for just over 4 months.  I've used it in extremely bright sun shine and in very low light situations (For both Still pictures and Video).  Its exceeded my expectations in all areas.  Its packed with so many features (High speed shutter operation, panorama photo's, Macro & Super Macro features, High Definition Videos and high quality slow motion videos).  Menus are well organized an easy to navigate.  Battery life is extremely good.  I have taken at least a 1000 photos and 2 hours of video footage on a single battery charge.  The controls are easy to use and provide tactile feed back, except for the power off button.  One other feature that is rarely discussed, is downloading of video's and pictures from your camera to your PC.  It downloads 100 2650x1980 pictures in less than 10 seconds.  Truly a speed demon.Casio Exilim EX-ZR100 12.1 MP CMOS Sensor with 12.5x Optical Zoom Digital Camera Black

Reviews.Title: Damn fine camera!!
Reviews.Author: sspudich
Reviews.Content: This the second Exilim that I bought. The first was in 2007. Liked the small footprint, and features, just to name a few, but this one left the other in the dust. "Great camera" does not do it justice.

Reviews.Title: Ok, but a critical flaw in HS video mode compared to prior model
Reviews.Author: Cullinaire "Oh yeah"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera with the primary intention of filming golf swings in high speed video for analysis. There's a lot to like about the camera in this role - compact, lightweight, decent battery life, and easy controls for quickly capturing many videos.Overall quality of the videos themselves are similar to the prior Casio models in this class.Unfortunately, a key feature that was present in the previous model, the FH100, was removed in the ZR100: manual shutter speed selection for the high speed video mode. What this means is that high shutter speeds will not be used during high speed video capture which will cause fast moving objects to appear blurry. While this may not sound like a big issue, for golf swing analysis this is a big miss. A very important part of diagnosing swing issues is seeing what happens at impact, and this is where the clubhead will be moving quite quickly (hopefully). You will not be able to accurately see what is going on with videos from the ZR100, as the entire area will be a mess of blurry clubhead, ball, and maybe airborne turf.There are rumors of a firmware update that would enable the feature, but I won't hold my breath. My next high speed video camera purchase will definitely require an adjustable shutter speed feature. Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: EX-ZR100 an amazingly versatile "point and shoot"
Reviews.Author: old_coach
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Casio EX-ZR100 on the recommendation of a friend who was watching the World Track and Field Championships in Daegu, So. Korea.  He wrote and told me he was seeing a lot of the coaches shooting this compact point and shoot high speed camera and the results were amazing.  I do a lot of video analysis in my work, and took his word.  I received the camera in six days, and spent one night reading the operation manual and playing with the camera to learn how to initiate the bells and whistles.  I had read some of the reviews that said the "ease" of moving around in the camera's program was a problem.  I say...read the information supplied and you will find this tool easy and quick to go from need to need.I shot the camera for a week in Maui.  I took many stills and many clips.  The stills allow for manual settings, but for my part the auto settings were easy and very good quality.  The "art" setting created some amazing shots of the ocean, sunsets, and settings around the Wailea area.  I took night movies and got great quality shooting at 240/fps.  Some of my test clips were taken at up to 1000/fps, and while they were good, they were not as clear as the slower but very adequate setting.  The "panorama" feature is good, but takes a little practice to master the rate of movement across the field of vision.In summary I would offer that there may be better cameras if you seek to take primarily still "travel" genre pictures.  If you want the addition of an excellent, low priced tool to gather high speed movement studies, this would be a wonderful purchase.

Reviews.Title: Overall, a very fun camera to use
Reviews.Author: R. Fieser
Reviews.Content: I have owned maybe 20 digital cameras in the past 10 years. This has been among the most fun to use. The things I really like about it are:1. the superfast burst mode (up to 30fps). I love to take pictures of sports (baseball, soccer, track and field, etc.). This camera enables me to catch the moment when the batter hits the ball, the high jumper clears the bar, the goalie stops the shot).2. the hdr mode which usually gives me pictures without blackened shadows or blown out highlights.3. slow motion video, though at less than VGA resolution. Good for golfers wanting to analyze their swing, useful for coaches wanting to give helpful advice to athletes on their mechanics when jumping, sprinting, punching, etc.4. The panoramic mode where you can get 360 degree shots at up to 1080 by 9600 or so).What I wish Casio would change or improve are:1. the image stablization (I think Panasonic's is better)2. the resolution of the slow motion video. The older FH100 could do VGA (640 X 480) at 210 or 240fps).If you just want still shots with no HDR, no super fast burst mode, and no panorama shooting, you might be able to get a better deal elsewhere, but the features and the performance of this camera make it a bargain for people like me.

Reviews.Title: Great step up from the EX-FC100
Reviews.Author: William Clinton
Reviews.Content: I have used the FC100 for a couple of years now and have been happy with it. I am by no means a pro but I have over 75000 family photos from many years. I take pictures of just about everything with the belief that time will make them invaluable. My theory is to take pictures of people not things. Things seldom change - people do. Anyway, back to the camera. It is great. Many times faster than earlier models. Pictures are great. The panorama mode is cool. The biggest difference for me was the 24MM wide angle lens. It alone is worth it for me. Captures things that I wasn't able to capture before. It retained its pocket size but is just a little bigger. No big deal for me. I had to order a slightly larger case for it. The batteries from my earlier model don't fit it either but they are $4 a piece on ebay. I am still playing with it but think its a real winner for the casual user.

Reviews.Title: Great in theory, but so fragile!
Reviews.Author: J. Broadley
Reviews.Content: I am a life long Canon Camera user and I wanted to try something different.  The Casio Exilim EX-ZR100 camera was recommended to me by a reputable camera shop, but I bought it at Amazon, rather than from them, because of the better price.Anyway, it takes great pictures in daylight or dim daylight, where they come out so clear and sharp.But in artificial light, they come out yellow and fuzzy.I didn't get to go much farther than that, cause the camera lens stopped functioning after only a couple of weeks in my possession. Not sure if it was a manufacturer flaw or if I bumped or jiggled the camera somehow, but if that's the case, there is no way that this baby would be able to stand up to normal wear and tear!The nice thing was that despite the fact that after the malfunction, the taking-pictures part of the camera wouldn't turn on, the downloading of pictures mode did work.  I have never seen this feature in any other digital before.I am giving it 3 stars, because it really does take great daylight pictures.After this experience I am going back to my old faithful Canon and I promise to never stray again.

Reviews.Title: Casio Exilim ZR100
Reviews.Author: Terry L. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because of the increased zoom.  Casio is also one of the only cameras that allow the date to appear on the picture - which is very helpful in keeping track of my photos.  The camera is easy to use - takes great pictures - love the zoom capability - the videos are great - and the Best Shot feature takes pictures so quickly that you don't miss any good shots with kids and pets.  I'm really happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Felt cheap
Reviews.Author: Tom C.
Reviews.Content: Felt cheap and had loose battery door. Image quality wasn't as good as the comparable Canon PowerShot SX230 HS. The high speed of this camera isn't as clear as the SX230 HS. Although this camera could do much higher fps, the resolution got so small, and quality was so grainy, it wasn't nearly as nice.Returned this product with no problems. Good seller.I recommend the Canon PowerShot SX230 HS over this camera

Reviews.Title: Great bargain as a golf swing video camera.
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Katalbas
Reviews.Content: This is a great video camera for golfers who want to see their golf swing in slow motion. We all know that when it comes to swinging the golf club, "What you think you are doing is often so totally different from what you are doing."  That's why Tiger Woods has a swing coach who takes a mental picture of his swing mechanics.  But with this camera, I don't think there's a swing coach in planet earth who can record and play with the naked eye as efficiently as this camera does. For less than two hundred fifty bucks, the resolution of the camera is good enough for the purpose of meaningfully analyzing the mechanics of the golf swing.  But as a camera to take still pictures, its anti-shake and zooming features suck.  To see a sample of a golf swing in slow motion video of this camera, I posted a couple in youtube and can be easily searched by entering "Casio Exilim EX ZR100 240fps Slow Motion Golf Swing".

Reviews.Title: Casio Exilim high Speed Camera
Reviews.Author: Christian Pozzar
Reviews.Content: I use this camera mostly for work .I take a lot of pictures for my technical reports and slow motion movie to analyse the kinetic of the machine that cannot be seen at naked eye. This camera does the job of a $35,000.00 high speed camera in some cases.... The only weak point is the definition at 1000 F/s and the lighting at the speed.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Mr. P. Robshaw "Maxp"
Reviews.Content: Video quality poor when viewed on VLC tends to judder and is unwatchable. (MOV format)Fast photos at high resolution (10MB/ photo 40 per second) is impressive.Battery overheats on bright screen and can disable the camera till cooled down.Screen quality poor compared with other Casio Exilim High speed such as FC100.

Reviews.Title: Best Point and Shoot ever - Best video camera ever
Reviews.Author: K. Bibby "baybrook_books"
Reviews.Content: I have lots of cameras but this thing is wonderful not only is it small and takes great photos it is the best video camera ever with HD and High Speed video it is just cool to use.  My Iphone has a great snapshot camera but this one takes much nicer photos and video.  It is the only point and shoot that takes great 400fps video which is why I bought it to take video of machinery but it is just all around fun to do for sports and such.  I took a great video of the 2 Maglev trains passing on another at 400+ kph cool.  Its best feature is separate buttons for video and photos, no need to change modes just push the shutter release on the top of the camera or the video start on the back.  Love this thing.

Reviews.Title: Great camera and great value
Reviews.Author: Alessandro N. Mattos
Reviews.Content: Great camera, full of features. Great price for it also. The good processing capability makes the photo processing fast and turn on times very short. The high speed videos are of limited quality and need a very well lit environment, otherwise the image gets very dark. The continuos shooting at even 40 fps is perfect. Very good battery life, above average. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable Features, Awesome Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Gabe M
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with this camera.  It has an unbelievable shutter speed and a number of on-camera features that make this little device rival prosumer bodies many hundreds, if not thousands, of dollars more.  For the price and the size, there really is no better camera out there.  Very impressed and thrilled to have this as our family's daily use cam.

Reviews.Title: golf swing analysis
Reviews.Author: golf bug
Reviews.Content: This is a very good piece of equipment. Great clear picture. The lens was loose on the first one sent and the instructions on not to return the battery charger were not clear. I only hope the charger has been returned to me as well as the new camera. Here's hoping as I am anxious to analyse my friends golf swings.

Reviews.Title: Good, but flash not great
Reviews.Author: L. Olsen
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace a great Casio 750. Many new features, and if you value those capabilities, this might be for you (videos are real good). But most of my pictures are strict point and shoot of family members, and I find the ZR-100 to fall short if flash is involved. Seems to have a problem with too much flash when the distance is short, and the distance is short when shooting pictures of my young kids. The Casio 750 managed this by having a "soft flash" setting and it worked very well.But the biggest issue is the extreme shutter lag when using flash! I am not talking about the flash recharge time, which is indicated by a small light that turns green. So one would think the camera is ready to go, but it isn't. Even with the shutter half pressed, and the pre focus in action, the lag between pushing the shutter and the flash actualy firing is extreme. It can be on the order of one second! This makes it very hard to catch kids.Maybe Casio added too many features, and forgot the basics? The 750 was such a great camera, I figured the next generation Casio's would be as good or better. Not the case, so I am going to look for a replacement.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera for those who has Kids
Reviews.Author: AL AMIN
Reviews.Content: Loved the high speed video, HDR and swipe panorama feature, didn't like the HDR-ART feature (it is worthless). The video quality is excellent. Didn't like the low light pictures as it comes quite grainy.

Reviews.Title: 1000 FPS Not so Great
Reviews.Author: C. Gilboy
Reviews.Content: Purchased this as a replacement for another camera to shoot movies of my golf swing and more. The first camera at 30 fps could not slow down the swing to see what was happening when.This camera works great for that. Just viewed some videos of my son pitching, easily switch from 30 fps to 240 to slow down. This permits you to record the first movements in regular speed and then switch to 240 fps to see the detailed motion.I had viewed some great videos of trap shooting where you could clearly see the shot breaking the clay pigeon at 1000 fps. I guess that was the $2,000 or $3,000 camera. The 1000 FPS on this camera is only 64 pixels high x 224 wide. Not really useful.Buy this for the 240 FPS and possibly the 480 fps settings.

Reviews.Title: Meh .. Nothing Special
Reviews.Author: MDHZ
Reviews.Content: I sought out a camera to replace my stolen EX-FH100.  The first place I went was to Casio.  My primary goal was to find a good HD camera which did video in slow motion.The camera seems well built enough.  The menu is intuitive and the layout is good.I returned the camera because Casio limited the slow motion capabilities (now it requires you drop the resolution for certain frame rates).  While this camera does 1080p vs the EX-FH100's 720p, I found the video quality to be much less than impressive.All in all .. it was an "ok" camera.  But I was looking for something with better 1080p video quality, and better slow-motion video options.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, if you read Japanese.
Reviews.Author: MJO "MJO"
Reviews.Content: I read about this camera before purchasing & liked the features.  When it came, the camera was ONLY in Japanese, no other language including English.  I looked back at the page I purchased it from, and virtually all were shipped from Japan.  The manual was in Japanese only & downloaded the English version which was of no help, but it did say if it was shipped from Japan, it may only be in Japanese, as it is.  Now the haggling starts. In short, if you buy it, make sure it is NOT shipped from Japan (as most of them are).

Reviews.Title: Worked great ...until it didn't
Reviews.Author: Comm Doc "Willie"
Reviews.Content: I received this camera for a birthday present and absolutely loved it for almost a year when it just stopped working. Customer service was no help via the 800 number and when I sent the camera back to where it was purchased they had it for two months. When I finally did get it back (I had to pay shipping each way), it was exactly as it had been when I initially contacted the shop. This should not happen to a $400 camera and what should really happen, hasn't: the shop should simply replace it or refund the cost.

Reviews.Title: Excellent consumer-level high speed camera!
Reviews.Author: Ryan R Ruhl
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for science experiments, dog agility, or just having fun.  In addition to the high frame rate, the camera also records in full HD.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Claire H "Gadget Girl"
Reviews.Content: I had the earlier version for years and loved the 1000 fpm as well as the great pics. This one is even cooler with the panorama feature. I have no idea why Casio has dropped this line of cameras as they were the only ones affordable for amature photographers with the high speed video. I just hope they come out with another one that has the features...but this one will be my go to for a long time.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: Dinarte
Reviews.Content: very good experience, I recommend it widely, the shipment arrived on time. the product was exactly the that I wanted

Reviews.Title: Great Low Cost High Speed Camera
Reviews.Author: Hobbynut
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera about 18 months ago specifically for machine analysis using the high frame rate capability.  At 240 FPS it takes more then adequate movies even in ambient room light.  In fact I have never needed to use a high powered flood light I purchased for this work.  To purchase a "professional" high speed camera would cost several thousand dollars.  The price of this camera was less then the cost of renting one.  Unless you need a faster frame rate then 240FPS this camera should fit the bill nicely plus it is less bulky then a "professional" high speed camera.  I have also used it for general picture taking with good results. I have found the panorama feature both amusing and useful.  In all a great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Casio Digital Camera Review
Reviews.Author: maryp
Reviews.Content: The camera works exactly how I expected.  I have two friends who have this camera also and they love theirs.  I was so glad that Amazon had a few in stock for me.  You definitely made my life easier.

Reviews.Title: Good high speed camera
Reviews.Author: Ducky
Reviews.Content: This was bought as a gift for my athlete daughter who needed a high speed camera to record her sport and play it back in slo mo to see where she could improve. So far, I've heard only good things about it from her.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - let's hope it lasts
Reviews.Author: Michael V. Spanjer "Spanker"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really like it. We don't have time for a lot of post-production so the in-camera panorama and in-camera HDR are very useful.  Zoom and speed are awesome for a camera of this price and this size.  In many circumstances, it can replace my big heavy Panasonic Lumix FZ50.  Another good feature is the macro setting, which is good for taking pictures of bugs.High speed burst with lag correction is fun...it will take 40 pics per second, and can start taking them BEFORE you press the shutter button down all the way.  Warning: You will take too many pics if you abuse this setting.  high speed and regular photography is also possible while shooting video.Great telephotoGood low light performance, especially for something with such a small lense diameter.Of course with this type of camera, no good way to add filters to the lens.  Pretty standard though.Left/Right buttons can be programmed for quick access to your favorite menu function (I use mine for macro/infinity/auto/manual focus)Some minor flaws not worth taking away a star:There are loose parts inside the camera...not rattling, but they can be felt shifting when the camera is moved.  As long as it doesn't break I can deal with that.The camera is hard to grip with one hand...always use the lanyard!  If you do you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: The HDR feature is amazing
Reviews.Author: Richard L. Morgan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera primarily for the built in HDR feature. The reviews did not look good but HDR seems to be loved or hated depending on the photographer. What I like about it is, on a cloudy day where there are hit and miss patches of blue sky, HDR does a great job of bringing out some sunshine in what would normally be a dismal shot. And having built into the camera with results appearing in 2 or 3 seconds is phenomenal.Also another reviewer said the camera is fun even though he is a typical DSLR photographer. He is right. The camera is fun, fast and adapts to a wide range of shooting conditions very quickly.The bad news is that it does not work with Eye-Fi cards, as stated in the manual.Also please note that the camera package comes with a battery charge, but no SD media/chip. The camera is well worth the money if photography is your hobby. I have already sent away for a poster size print that I will hang on the wall. You will get some great shots that will make you proud.

Reviews.Title: good but not perfect
Reviews.Author: M. Preyer "Mark"
Reviews.Content: bought this for a varity of reasons.  I am generally happy.  Good pictures but maybe not as good as a Nikon.  Good video particularly the high spped but requires a lot of light at high speed to work.  Also, really not much us for the highest speeds.  It is a good camera for the price.  Battery life is great !!!

Reviews.Title: must have camera - very satisfactory
Reviews.Author: Agus
Reviews.Content: At first I used the camera just to fulfill my amateur photography hobby as I had my Nikon Coolpix S570 everywhere I went. However, I started to fall in love with this camera as the picture results and recovery speed (shoot again and again) were incredibly amazing - compared with my Nikon (without flash in a daylight). Even with flash still, the flash recovery speed is great. The flash is quite fast (won't hurt your eyes) but the result is great. This Casio ZR-100 becomes my major camera as its compactness and capability. A number of my friends admitted that my camera (ZR-100) was a great camera. My girl likes it too, we took a lot of pictures. She praised this camera a number of times. I plan to get one more for her.

Reviews.Title: This camera delivers!
Reviews.Author: Unknown
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for two reasons:  (1) Casio and (2) HDR (High-Dynamic Range) capability.This camera delivers!Casio?  Yes Casio.  Casio has the best image-processing software in the business.  The build quality is superb.  The optics -- outstanding.  The battery life -- exceptional.But the HDR feature is remarkable.  The EX-ZR100 has captured great photos in places where my other (10+) digital cameras had always failed me -- for example, on nature walks where there is partial shade/sun, in museums where flash photography is not allowed.As described, the HDR feature "combines information from a burst of multiple images and unites the most detailed portions of each image (taken at different exposures) for a beautiful, never-before-possible wide dynamic range".One activation of the shutter gives you a "click-click-click-click" of multiple images being recorded and then you end up with a "merged" photo that gives you the best image quality across all areas of the photo.  Visible detail (e.g. visible faces) out of shadows, most notably.I haven't used the high-speed capability.  So no comment there.My gripe would be that the between-photo times are a bit slow.  But that is common for most digital cameras, if not all.  (My Samsung NV24HD has spoiled me in that regard.)Is there a perfect digital camera?  Not yet.  But this one is very close.I hope the EX-ZR300 is available in the U.S.  Don't give up on the U.S., Casio!

Reviews.Title: Was great when it worked
Reviews.Author: S. Raj
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from Amazon and it was used sparingly for outdoor / golf swing recording only. Pretty happy with the results.This season I tried to turn-on the camera but camera is not starting. I made sure that battery is fully charged; also took memory card out (as suggested in FAQ) but no luck. I notice one symptom - front lamp flashes for fraction of seconds when I pop the battery in and then nothing happens. The camera is completely dead other than "front lamp" activity.Customer support suggested to buy a new battery which I did but still no luck. Camera has exactly same symptom even with new battery. I also checked and found that both batteries are in good shape."Casio America, Elite Service" wants me to pay $39-299 for repair (they'll tell exact amount after receiving and evaluating the defective product) even though product was purchased less than a year ago :-(I think this is going to be my last CASIO purchase.

Reviews.Title: Camera review
Reviews.Author: Tina M Robichaux
Reviews.Content: The Casio Exilim EX-ZR100 12.1 MP CMOS Sensor with 12.5x Optical Zoom Digital Camera Black arrived when promised.  It was a Christmas gift for my husband and he just loves it.

Reviews.Title: Great on paper, not quite so great in reality....
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "MontWat"
Reviews.Content: The specs looked great...I ordered the Sony HX5V, the Casio EX-FH100 and the Casio EX-ZR100 from Amazon. The winnah is the HX5V.As for this EX-ZR100The anti-shake was no great shakes.The pictures weren't too good unless you used a flash.The HDR mode where it combines multiple shots into one, alas doesn't allow you to use a flash.The HDR art mode is, well, art, not a still picture.The 360 degree panorama is nishePictures from the Casio EX-FH100 were sharper and clearer. Pictures from the Sony HX5V were the best.The ballyhooed AE mode is not that great with only two settings.The shutter speed mode unless combined with very high ISO produced crappy images. AT very high ISO it was okay. Barely ok.See my customer images and make your own decision.

Reviews.Title: Lifespan - 8 months
Reviews.Author: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience with my Exilim EX-Z750, so after I dropped it in the drink I bought this camera for the features.  I saw one review where the camera went tats up, but the rest were stellar.  After 8 months of use, not really using the features I thought I would, I picked it up to shoot and it had a green light on, normal . . .  It's dead as a zombie now and outside the warranty window, as I bought it used/like new for nearly the same price as a new one.  Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: Underwhelmed
Reviews.Author: Marko
Reviews.Content: My last Casio camera, an EX-S10 was very good.  I ruined it at the beach.  I needed a new camera, and after some study thought I would enjoy the EX-ZR100.  I thought some of the features were, well, dumb to say the least, like the "art mode" and the "premium best shot".  Why not just have one best shot?Anyway, I never got to use the camera.  When it arrived, I was not impressed with its appearance.  Compared to the S10's solid metal machined appearance, the all-black ZR100 looked a little cheap.  Mind you, compared to the other cameras I looked at in the store the other day, it still looked a bit better.  The on/off switch and mikes on top looked like they were afterthoughts grafted on with surplus parts.The camera itself is, compared to the others in this class, not as thick but definitely much bigger than the S10 (which has been replaced by the S12).  The screen is big, sure, but overall doesn't feel that much bigger.But finally, I noticed that the lens cylinder rattles in the camera housing, whether extended or not.  This in a $250 camera!  Anyway this was the straw that broke the camel's back, and I noticed that other ZR100 owners have had the same problem with repeat cameras.  Casio apparently fixes this under warranty but there are enough other reasons I'm not overwhelmed with this camera that I'm returning it for a refund.  I expected better from Casio!

Reviews.Title: NOT and "idiot camera."
Reviews.Author: Osaggie
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera a year ago, and still haven't been able to change functions, etc., using the manual, which, yes, I printed out from a disc provided by the seller (NYC retailer).  This camera has been a huge disappointment -- for me, of course, not any kind of photographer.  And after having spent several (more) hours today trying to "set" settings, I will call Casio customer service tomorrow for assistance.  If things work out, I will of course edit this review to reflect any improvement in my experience.  If you really only want a great "point and shoot," this is way too sophisticated for you.

Reviews.Title: VERY VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE BY THE CUSTOMER SERVICE REP AND MANAGER
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: The camera is very good but sales people didn't have a camera case available for the camera and not sure when they could get one. I received the camera and then the little sticky disc on top of the camera that indicates what mode the camera is in fell off the camera. This is only a little piece of very thin plastic. I called and asked to have another one shipped and they said that they couldn't do that. I instead would have to send the camera to CASIO and pay the freight and repair for a camera that was less than 1 month old. This is what the Customer Service Rep Manager told me. I tried several times to call and talk with her regarding the "sticky disc" (left a message) and no phone call was returned. Finally did get thru to her and she said that she would work on it and give me a call back. This has been like this, going on THREE MONTHS and NO PNONE CALL.Bottom line, very good product but VERY VERY VERY BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!

Reviews.Title: well.......
Reviews.Author: Indian "Indian"
Reviews.Content: Pros : Panaromic mode (Awesome!!), slow motion 480fps (needs good amount of light)Cons : blurry Pictures in any mode.. I could never get a good focused sharp picture, Image stabilization, build quality I could hear moving parts.I will update with more details in next couple of days.. most likely I will return this product.

Reviews.Title: COMES WITH NO BOOKLET!
Reviews.Author: Karen S.
Reviews.Content: I SPENT A LOT OF HOURS CHECKING OUT MANY CAMERAS AND FINALLY SETTLED ON THE CASIO ZR100.  BOUGHT IT AND THE ONLY INSTRUCTIONS INCLUDED IS A SHEET ABOUT 24" X 24".  NO BOOKLET.  I EVEN OFFERED TO BUY ONE FROM THE COMPANY BUT THEY ONLY SUGGEST THAT YOU DOWNLOAD IT ON YOUR COMPUTER.  THEY DO NOT PRINT A BOOKLET. I DON'T KNOW ABOUT YOU BUT I DON'T CARRY MY COMPUTER TO THE BEACH OR INTO THE WOODS WHEN I AM TAKING PHOTOS.  I SUGGEST THAT YOU FIND ANOTHER COMPANY.  GOOD LUCK.

Reviews.Title: no auto preview?
Reviews.Author: rooster_ranch
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's just my particular new camera malfunctioning but after I take a picture with this model, it doesn't let me preview it for one second as the quick start guide states it should.  I have to manually hit the button to preview it which is pointless.  Will be returning it for a refund.  I wish I could find a decent point and shoot camera in this price range!!!
